DOC.brief_summary: The study objective is to clarify whether the application of high doses CPFA (Coupled Plasma-Filtration Adsorption) in addition to the current clinical practice is able to reduce hospital mortality in septic shock patients in intensive care unit (ICU).
DOC.brief_title: Mortality Reduction in Septic Shock by Plasma Adsorption
DOC.criteria: all patients admitted to the ICU in septic shock all patients that develop septic shock while in the ICU Age less than 18 years Pregnancy Estimated life expectancy (due to comorbidities) less than 90 days Presence of relative or absolute contraindications to CPFA Absence of informed consen
